data.title: an error occurrence when use atom
data.body:

data.title: "Reload Specs" button does nothing
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The interactive specs window does not close the first time you click the "x" button.  It only closes after the second time.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. `window:run-package-specs`
2. Hit the "Reload Specs" button
3. ...
4. Click it a few more times
5. ...

**Expected behavior:** Specs window to reload

**Actual behavior:** Specs window stares at you defiantly
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.12.0-dev-5264fae
Electron: 1.3.5
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.3.0
```

```
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.9.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

Windows 10 x64.

data.title: Specs window does not close the first time
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The interactive specs window does not close the first time you click the "x" button.  It only closes after the second time.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. `window:run-package-specs`
2. Attempt to close specs window using the "X" button
3. ...
4. Attempt to close it again

**Expected behavior:** Specs window to close

**Actual behavior:** Specs window stares at you defiantly
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.12.0-dev-5264fae
Electron: 1.3.5
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.3.0
```

```
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.9.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

Windows 10 x64.

data.title: New feature or package google translate package possible?
data.body:
Is it possible to make package for atom for translation like this
![atom-google-tranlate](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2714036/18419913/a163c3b8-786e-11e6-96da-b6e94c351989.gif)

Something like this:

```
url = "https://translate.google.com/?en=en#en/ru/#{cased}"
        # Shell.openExternal url
      xmlHttp = new XMLHttpRequest()
      xmlHttp.open( "GET", url, false )
      xmlHttp.onreadystatechange = ->
          if this.readyState == 4
              parser = new DOMParser()
              doc = parser.parseFromString(xmlHttp.responseText, "text/html")
              resultbox = doc.getElementById("result_box")
              alert(resultbox.innerHTML)
      xmlHttp.send( null )
      console.log(xmlHttp.responseText)
```

data.title: Bad performance on files with a long line - LinesYardstick::clientRectForRange
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Files that have a long lines make the interace un responsive
### Steps to Reproduce

 As an example this test case of 9000 chars json line using `plain text` grammar and the code line at [this gist](https://gist.github.com/gandm/abad639f1f3e6f8afbc292cbbc5b49a5)  repeatedly calls to LinesYardStick::clientRectForRange() with startIndex always 0 and the EndIndex starting at 0 moving incrementally over the range of the line. e.g. (0,1) (0,20) (0,21) (0,37)..... On my machine this takes 7 seconds to complete, during which time the interface is frozen! A line 3 times that length takes over a minute to unlock the interface O(n2)? 

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Something sensible!

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Atom becomes unusable.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.9
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio 2013

data.title: Remove window load time console output
data.body:
The _"Window load time: ..."_ console message doesn't really provide any tangible benefit, and is generally just annoying as 💩 when running specs.

Additionally, I believe on Windows this is printed in the terminal when Atom is launched via `atom.cmd`.

/cc @atom/feedback @nathansobo @damieng

data.title: atom helper crashed on exit
data.body:
Atom helper crashes on exit of Atom started from terminal in safe mode (also crashes if opened with icon). There are multiple Atom Helper processes started when I open the app this way?
Mac: OS X ElCapitain
10.11.6

Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

[atom helper crash.crash.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/465968/atom.helper.crash.crash.zip)

data.title: :arrow_up: language-perl@v0.36.0
crashReporter submitURL points to non-existant domain
data.body:
Code is here: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/crash-reporter-start.js#L6

``` sh
~ $ host crashreport.atom.io
Host crashreport.atom.io not found: 3(NXDOMAIN)
```

I have no idea what the impact of this is, but I have to imagine it means that crash reporting doesn't work.

data.title: Does Atom have an opinion on the future of Coffeescript?
data.body:
Hi guys,

A quick heads up that there's a pretty active discussion going on over at [coffeescript6/discuss](https://github.com/coffeescript6/discuss) about possible next steps for Coffeescript.

Thought you might want to comment, given Atom is a heavy Coffeescript user. Discussed issues are [here](https://github.com/coffeescript6/discuss/issues).

There's also a survey that's relevant to you: [Survey for devs/teams with maintained Coffescript codebases: happy with CS, or considering migrating?](https://github.com/coffeescript6/discuss/issues/32)

data.title: Opening a recent file causes an "item selected is unavailable" error
data.body:
### Description

Trying to open a recent file from the taskbar on windows causes an error.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Right click on atom icon on the taskbar
2. Click on a recent file to open

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1727302/18408474/4c10ef28-7763-11e6-8acc-a89fc69074fc.png)

**Expected behavior:**

Atom should open the file in to the editor

**Actual behavior:** 

Error is shown

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1727302/18408473/438519ec-7763-11e6-885e-e4ae6e742801.png)
### Versions

Windows 10 64 bit

Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.10
git 2.9.0.windows.1
visual studio 2015

data.title: `PaneContainer::getPanes()` doesn't include added pane in `onDidAddPane` or `observePanes` callback
Fix source maps for typescript and babel on Windows
data.body:
The source maps for babel and typescript never worked correctly on windows as the path was treated by the Chromium debugger as relative because it was not prefixed with file:///.  This led to a weird issue where the source map was thought to be in a different folder to the generated JS.

This corrects it using the same approach we use for Coffeescript and also removes the 'App load time' which is the last thing spewing onto the command line at start-up now Electron has been upgraded.

data.title: Complete loss of subpixel antialiasing
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

After the Electron 1.3.5 upgrade, I've noticed a complete loss of subpixel antialiasing in Atom.  Code, tree-view, status-bar, you name it are all grayscale antialiased.  If there's any way I can help debug this please let me know because it's starting to hurt my eyes :(.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. `atom --safe`
2. Zoom in using Magnify

**Expected behavior:** Colorful subpixel antialiasing

**Actual behavior:** Grayscale :(
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

```
Atom    : 1.12.0-dev-4f1833a
Electron: 1.3.5
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.3.0
```

```
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.9.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

Windows 10 x64.

data.title: Upgrading packages doesn't recalculate canDeferMainModuleRequire using new code
data.body:
Recently, we (the Nuclide team) got bitten by what seems to be a bug in Atom's package manager when we switched from loading our "sub-packages" during Nuclide's activation phase to its loading phase.

It seems that, if you upgrade a package from within Atom, its new metadata (including the version) will be loaded immediately but `Package::load()` will still load the old version of the package ([because of the require cache](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.11.0-beta5/src/package.coffee#L441)). It'll then use that code to determine whether requiring the main module can be deferred and cache that in local storage. The next time Atom's loaded, it uses the (potentially inaccurate) cached value.

We noticed this because our code changed from allowing the deferment of requiring the main module to not, but Atom continued to defer loading.

Related:
- facebook/nuclide#698
- facebook/nuclide#699
- facebook/nuclide#700
- facebook/nuclide#701

data.title: Integrated terminal panel
data.body:
The terminal-plus package doesn't work on Atom from 1.9 and this is a must-have package for me.
So I think it should be better if we can have a terminal built in instead of waiting for a package to be updated.

data.title: Run main process tests on CircleCI, Travis and AppVeyor
data.body:
Previously we used to run tests only on CircleCI which, despite providing a pretty extensive coverage for macOS, is insufficient to understand whether something has regressed on other platforms. The ideal solution to this problem would be to run tests on every operating system: our renderer test suite, however, is particularly flaky on Linux and Windows as, with time, it has evolved without multi-platform compatibility in mind.

This pull-request is a first step towards such solution: instead of using Travis and AppVeyor as build-only providers, we will now run main process tests on them. These kind of tests are more coarse-grained than the renderer process ones, but they provide quick feedback and should act as good smoke tests for when we release new versions. We could have used `chromedriver` as well, but it seems like it's quite flaky on both Windows and Linux, so I have put that on hold for the time being (in a later pull-request, it might be interesting to change our current `smoke-spec` to use [electron/spectron](https://github.com/electron/spectron) instead and see if that changes anything).

/cc: @atom/core

data.title: Fix app not quitting on win32 and linux when closing the last window
data.body:
This regression was caused by a nuance in the way we maintain state in `AtomApplication` for open windows. Specifically, when closing the last window on Windows and Linux, we were explicitly calling `app.quit` _before_ removing such window from the list of open ones. In turn, this caused the new `before-quit` behavior introduced in #12619 to work improperly because it made the application wait on saving the state of a stale window before exiting.

With this pull-request we are fixing that by making sure the stale window is removed before calling `app.quit` in `removeWindow`.

/cc: @atom/core @damieng

data.title: how can i connect my github account in atom
data.body:
### Description

as the title say.
how can i set my github account in atom that i can commit my project easily.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a atom on my PC with windows.
2. import a project
3. i can't find out the options that it can connect on my github account when i want to commit my project into github.

**Expected behavior:** i can commit my project and use it happily.

**Actual behavior:** i can't find out where i can set my git server path.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.10.2

data.title: yea i can't download the atom.exe file for windows 10
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Setting the default syntax for new documents
data.body:
Each time I create a new document and paste in code (most typically HTML/CSS/PHP) it defaults to Plain Text. While of course you could save the document with a file extension and then will update the  syntax.

But for all the times where ones just pastes in the code to make a quick edit or check without the need or desire for saving the file, would be great to change the default file type.

There are several threads on here and the forum but they are in regards to changing the default file type for custom file extensions which isn't the issue I have. Does anyone know a config setting to adjust the default syntax for new documents (preferably without an extension if possible)?

data.title: Sub-pixel rendering does not occur when unlocking Atom on Macbook external monitor
data.body:
### Description

When unlocking mac OS on a macbook when atom is on a second monitor, the color of syntax highlighting is muted. The color fixes when the pane is updated by changing tabs. The screenshot below shows the muted color on the left, and the correct color (by changing the tab) on the right.

This does not appear to happen when waking the computer if atom is on the laptop screen. Its hard to tell, but the color appears to be fine for a split second, and then muted once the window is force-resized. This may happen on a desktop, but I don't have one to test with.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1187432/18359997/297866f2-75b1-11e6-898f-417644b42c35.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom on a second, external monitor on a macbook
2. Allow Mac to lock from inactivity OR lock from the lock in the toolbar. The System "Sleep" command will not work.
3. Wake the mac, and unlock the screen

**Expected behavior:** Color should appear normally

**Actual behavior:** Color is <s>muted</s> not sub-pixel rendered. Thanks to @simurai  for noticing
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```
